{"step_by_step_thinking": "Papain is a protease that cleaves proteins at specific sites. IgG has a unique structure with two heavy chains (Fc) and two light chains (Fab). Papain can cleave the hinge region between Fc and Fab, releasing the Fab fragments. This would result in 2 Fab fragments for each IgG molecule. The Fc region remains intact.", "answer_choice": "A"}
